title: 107_hr2310
content:
The "Military Pay Raise Act of 2001" increases monthly basic pay for uniformed services members effective January 1, 2002, based on pay grade and years of service. Commissioned officers' pay grades and percentage increases based on years of service under section 205 of title 37, United States Code are as follows:
O-10: 7.3%
O-9: 7.3%
O-8: 7.3%
O-7: 7.3%
O-6: 7.3% Commissioned officers' pay grades and percentage increases based on years of service under section 205 of title 37, United States Code are as follows:

Over 20: 7.3% WARRANT OFFICERS receive percentage increases in pay grade based on years of service, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades. Warrant officers receive percentage increases in pay grade based on years of service, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades. The pay scale shows incremental increases from W-5 to W-1, with percentages varying for different service lengths. Warrant officers receive percentage increases in pay grade based on years of service, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades. The pay scale shows incremental increases from W-5 to W-1, with percentages varying for different service lengths, up to Over 26. The pay scale for warrant officers shows percentage increases in pay grade based on years of service, ranging from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades, with incremental increases from W-5 to W-1, up to Over 26. The pay scale for warrant officers ranges from 7.5% to 8.5% for different pay grades, with incremental increases from W-5 to W-1. Enlisted members' years of service are calculated under section 205 of title 37, United States Code. The pay scale for different pay grades ranges from 8.5% to 10.5%, with incremental increases based on years of service. The pay scale for enlisted members ranges from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grades, with incremental increases for years of service. The pay scale for enlisted members ranges from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grades, with incremental increases for years of service. The percentages for each pay grade are as follows: E-1 to E-4 at 7.3%, E-7 to E-9 at 9.5% to 10.5%, with additional increments for higher ranks. The pay scale for enlisted members ranges from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grades, with incremental increases for years of service. The pay scale for enlisted members ranges from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grades, with incremental increases for years of service. The pay percentages for each pay grade are as follows: E-1 to E-4 at 7.3%, E-7 to E-9 at 9.5% to 10.5%. The pay scale for enlisted members ranges from 7.3% to 10.5% based on pay grades, with incremental increases for years of service. The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002 required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, will not be made.
